meanings.sent1: She outrowed her friend in the race.
meanings.sent2: The champion outrowed all the competitors effortlessly.
meanings.sent3: The little boat outrowed the big ship in the friendly race.
meanings.sent4: His determination outrowed his lack of experience on the water.
meanings.sent5: The rower's skill outrowed everyone's expectations.

meanings.definition: To defeat in a rowing competition
meanings.sent1: He outrowed his opponent by reaching the finish line first.
meanings.sent2: The team outrowed their rivals in the final match.
meanings.sent3: The ducks outrowed the swans in the rowing challenge.
meanings.sent4: Her strategy outrowed all other tactics in the competition.
meanings.sent5: The underdog outrowed the favorite with sheer determination.

meanings.sent1: The new rowing technique outrowed the traditional methods.
meanings.sent2: She outrowed her personal best time by a significant margin.
meanings.sent3: The rowing machine outrowed all other gym equipment in popularity.
meanings.sent4: His dedication outrowed his previous lack of skill.
meanings.sent5: The rower's passion outrowed any obstacles in her way.
